summary: Add support for single-page fetching in list workflows API. Currently the enumerable doesn't allow providing a next page token to fetch subsequent pages on demand; the request is to add a dedicated single-page method to enable manual pagination control.
userImpact: Users cannot manually control pagination when listing workflows; they must either fetch all at once or use automatic enumerable traversal.
rootCause: Current enumerable design doesn't expose page token handling for manual pagination control.
proposedFix: Create a dedicated `list_workflow_page` method with optional page_size and next_page_token parameters, returning a ListWorkflowPage object containing items and next page token, while refactoring `list_workflows` to use this internally.
resolutionDetails: Resolved by implementing a separate paginated method approach (#285) rather than dual return types.
keyQuote: Have two possible return types for `#list_workflows`, depending on whether `page_size` is `nil` or not... Define a separate method for the paginated version
